title: What are the essential qualities that a trader should possess to counter social hypnosis and avoid losses?
first_phrase: This final section of the text focuses on the necessary qualities a trader must possess to avoid falling into the trap of "social hypnosis" - the influence of external factors, institutions or individuals that can lead to irrational decision making. The section outlines the importance of being present, free from emotional constraints, connected to objectives, intuitive and possessing intuitive acumen. These are crucial qualities that will help traders achieve their goals and avoid losses in the long run.
content: The aforesaid does not mean the trader has to be cold. It simply denotes that he ought to be Free from the danger of his own subconscious reactions dictating matters. 3. Understanding and being connected to his objectives: The trading which produces the best results is founded upon targeted goals. Being FOCUSED is thus a necessary prerequisite. 4. Intuition and Lateral Thinking: We refer, by this term, to that ability possessed by our mind which enables us to avoid the trap of using only our logical side, in favour of a more comprehensive way which encompasses the capacity to grab and develop opportunities as well. 5. Intuitive acumen: It is a specific aspect of intuition, which will be elaborated upon in the course of the last chapter of the book. This aspect is closely linked to having the courage to gain access to one’s own inner resources. In a global market, it is the best operators who drive forward and progress. In the world of trading, we can see in action an even more intensified version of PARETO’s famous law, which states that 20% of all operations actually yield an 80% of actualized gains.
last_phrase: In conclusion, successful trading requires the trader to be free from subconscious reactions, have a clear understanding of their objectives, utilize intuition and lateral thinking, possess intuitive acumen, and most importantly, set a targeted goal with a specific timeframe. Avoid letting emotions like cupidity drive your decisions and focus on being one of the top 20% of traders who yield 80% of actualized gains.
